ray.rml

Interface SphericallyInterpolable<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type that can be interpolated.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Quaternion
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Quaternionf

    interface SphericallyInterpolable<T>
    A spherically interpolable object is one that supports spherical linear interpolation between itself and some other end-point.

    Spherical Linear interpolation, or slerp, is a method to calculate mid-points between the two ends of a unit-radius great circle arc based on an interporlation parameter in the [0, 1] range.

    An application of this principle is for smooth 3D animations (i.e. motion at a constant speed), using time t as the interpolation parameter. This method can overcome lerp limitations that cause motions to vary in speed.

    However, two different arcs, or paths, can be validly chosen between the same two ends, just like 3*PI/2 and -PI/2 reach the same end point, which may not be desirable. It's the implemetation's responsibility to make sure the shortest arc path is used. For arcs that are sufficiently small, using lerp might be preferable.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    LinearlyInterpolable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T slerp(T end, float t)
      Performs spherical linear interpolation from this to end by t, which is automatically clamped to the [0, 1] range.

    • Method Detail

      • slerp

        T slerp(T end,
        float t)
        Performs spherical linear interpolation from this to end by t, which is automatically clamped to the [0, 1] range.
        Parameters:
        end - The other end-point with which to interpolate along the arc.
        t - The interpolation parameter.
        Returns:
        A new instance with the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the end is null.
